questions.question_text: The ability to prevent users from resolving internet protocol (IP) addresses to malicious, grayware, or newly registered domains is provided by which Security service?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BC are correct
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-new-features/user-id-features/dynamic-user-groups

choices.A: Tag the user through Active Directory.
choices.C: Tag the user through the firewall's XML API.
choices.B: Tag the user using Panorama or the Web UI of the firewall.
choices.D: Add the user to an external dynamic list (EDL).

questions.question_text: What are two ways to manually add and remove members of dynamic user groups (DUGs)? (Choose two.)

A customer is starting to understand their Zero Trust protect surface using the Palo Alto Networks Zero Trust reference architecture.
What are two steps in this process? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Categorize data and applications by levels of sensitivity.
choices.C: Gain visibility of and control over applications and functionality in the traffic flow using a port and protocol firewall.
choices.A: Prioritize securing the endpoints of privileged users because if non-privileged user endpoints are exploited, the impact will be minimal due to perimeter controls.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Can't vote for 2 answers but B and D are correct

Selected Answer: B
BD are correct

Selected Answer: B
B and D
1, Zero Trust for users,
2, Zero Trust for applications
3, Zero Trust for infrastructure

Selected Answer: B
B and D. Zero Trust model is focused on users and applications.
https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/apps/pan/public/downloadResource?pagePath=/content/pan/en_US/resources/guides/zero-trust-overview
answer B and B fit best
it says select two but only D is the answer

Selected Answer: D
D seems to be valid as well.

questions.question_text: Which task would be included in the Best Practice Assessment (BPA) tool?

choices.D: Identify the visibility and presence of command-and-control (C2) sessions.
choices.A: Identify sanctioned and unsanctioned software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications.
choices.C: Identify the threats associated with each application.
choices.B: Identify and provide recommendations for device configurations.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The BPA for next-generation firewalls and Panorama evaluates a deviceâ€™s configuration by measuring the adoption of capabilities, validating whether the policies adhere to best practices, and providing recommendations and instructions for how to remediate failed best practice checks.

questions.question_text: Within the Five-Step Methodology of Zero Trust, in which step would application access and user access be defined?

choices.E: Step 4: Create the Zero Trust Policy
choices.B: Step 3: Architect a Zero Trust Network
choices.C: Step 5: Monitor and Maintain the Network
choices.D: Step 2: Map the Protect Surface Transaction Flows

discussion.content:
Answer D: Step 2
You have to MAP, to define the access
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/the-five-step-methodology

Selected Answer: E
important words are "app access" and "user access" https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/the-five-step-methodology/step-4-implementation#id8af03732-03e2-404a-9030-dfb63dfabffd

Selected Answer: E
The question it's when we are implementing and not when we are mapping.

Selected Answer: D
D, Map the transactions between users, applications, and data, so that you can verify and inspect those transactions. Map:
Which applications have access to which critical data.
Which users have access to those applications.
Which users and applications have access to which infrastructure.

Selected Answer: D
In step 2 is defined: Which applications have access to which critical data, which users have access to those applications and which users and applications have access to which infrastructure.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/the-five-step-methodology/step-2-map-the-protect-surface-transaction-flows
Step four is the implementation of securty rules based on definitions of previous steps.
